thread.title: These are the best restaurants in the Greater Manchester according to the Sunday Times
thread.title_full: These are the best restaurants in the Greater Manchester according to the Sunday Times

author: Lucy Lovell
title: These are the best restaurants in the Greater Manchester according to the Sunday Times
text:
These are the best restaurants in the Greater Manchester according to the Sunday Times The judges included Jamie Oliver and Antonio Carluccio Share Levanter, Ramsbottom (Photo: Levanter Facebook) Share Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Sunday Times reveals its top 100 restaurants list this weekend, and among the nine north west entries, only two Greater Manchester restaurants have made the cut. 
Spanish tapas bar Levanter impressed with star dishes such as Txuleton beef rib, proving that Ramsbottom is still one of Greater Manchester's most gastronomically pleasing enclaves. Umezushi , meanwhile, flies the flag for the city centre and offers an 'unrivalled spectrum of Japanese cooking', according to the newspaper. 
Further afield, Michelin-starred Northcote , described as having an 'international, big-city feel without ever forgetting it’s in rural Lancashire', and the Freemasons at Wiswell which produces food with 'finesse and confidence', also made the list. 
Nearby, Cumbria also has three restaurants in the top 100: L'Enclume by Simon Rogan who judges say is able to turn 'the humblest ingredients into gastronomic gold'; Gilpin in Windermere , which serves British Asian cuisine with dishes that 'look like works of art'; and The Lake Road Kitchen in Ambleside, with memorable dishes such as 199-day aged beef . Umezushi (Photo: Umezushi Facebook) Look inside Manchester's luxury new sports bar The Director's Box 
The Art School in Liverpool and Restaurant Fraiche in Oxton complete the list of north west entries. 
Laurel Ives, editor of The Sunday Times Top 100 Restaurants, said: “The Sunday Times Top 100 Restaurants judging panel is made up of some of the most experienced and knowledgeable people in the industry, from chefs and owners, to our own expert writers. 
"They have picked out the very best establishments that the UK’s impressive culinary scene has to offer." A dish from the 20 course tasting menu at L'Enclume (Photo: Lucy Lovell) 
The list excludes two Manchester restaurants which have been famously battling it out for a Michelin star: Manchester House, which missed out on a coveted accolade again last year; and The French, headed up by Adam Reid , which is currently undergoing a major refurbishment and set to re-open next month with a more informal, open-plan fit out.
